generif.text: The FLJ20171 gene was shown to effectively separate these two chromophobe renal cell carcinoma (RCC) and benign oncocytoma groups by quantitative reverse transcription-PCR using fresh tissue samples, with similar trends seen on formalin-fixed tissues.

Results demonstrate that RBM35A functions as a tumor suppressor in colon cancer cells, and suggest that RBM35A is involved in posttranscriptional regulation of a number of genes by exerting a differential effect on protein translation via 5'UTRs of mRNAs.
ESRP1 and ESRP2 are epithelial cell-type-specific regulators of FGFR2 splicing.
results further establish ESRP1 and ESRP2 as global regulators of an epithelial splicing regulatory network.

ESRP1 coordinates a complex alternative splicing network that adds an important post-transcriptional layer to the changes in gene expression that underlie epithelial-mesenchymal transitions during development and disease.
The functional significance of EMT-associated alternative splicing was tested by expression of the epithelial-specific splicing factor ESRP1
deltaEF1 family proteins repress the expression of ESRPs to regulate alternative splicing during TGF-beta-induced EMT and the progression of breast cancers
functions of the ESRP1 in an epithelial posttranscriptional gene expression program.
ESRP1 could be a master regulator of the EMT process in pituitary adenomas causing acromegaly.
the transcription repressor Snail binds to E-boxes in the ESRP1 promoter, causing repression of the ESRP1 gene.
ESRP1 and PNN modulate alternative splicing of a specific subset of target genes, but not general splicing events, in HCET cells to maintain or enhance epithelial characteristics.

Data suggest that alternative splicing in ESRP1 transcripts in somatotroph adenomas is essential in epithelial-mesenchymal transition progression and in response to somatostatin analog antineoplastic treatment.

Results show that ESRP1 regulates the expression pattern of FGFR-2 isoforms, attenuates cell growth, migration, invasion and metastasis, and is a favorable prognostic factor in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
ESRP1 and ESRP2 suppress cancer cell motility via different mechanisms.
MCL1 with the deletion of 801G and 802A sites could not be correctly spliced by ESRP1 and no significant difference was seen in the expressions of isoform 1 and 3 in mutant MCL1
Data show that both rab G-Protein RAB25 and RNA-binding protein ESRP1 were suppressed by transcription factor ZEB1, which was in turn regulated via epigenetic mechanisms.
Altered Expression and Splicing of ESRP1 in Malignant Melanoma Correlates with Epithelial-Mesenchymal Status and Tumor-Associated Immune Cytolytic Activity.

Recombinant human ESRP1-RRM3 was subjected to biomolecular NMR and its chemical shifts and structural coordinates were determined and deposited in the BioMagResBank and Protein Data Bank respectively. Its interaction with RBPMS2 was mapped.

ALK oncogenic activity is involved in the regulation of an epithelial mesenchymal transition phenotype in a subset of non-small cell lung carcinomas by repression of the epithelial splicing regulatory protein 1.
The molecular mechanisms by which ESRP1 and ESPR2 exert positive as well as negative effects on cancer progression have been summarized. (Review)
ZEB1-induced epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition and associated molecular changes in ESRP1 and CD44 contribute to early pathogenesis and metastatic potential in established lung cancer
Our study supports the role of ESRP1 as tumor suppressor and strongly suggests that ESRPs are candidate markers for early detection, diagnosis, and prognosis of CRC.

Results showed that the expression patterns of these genes were indicative of the onset of EMT in in-vitro models, but not in tissue samples. However, the ratio between ESRP1 or ESRP2 and RBFOX2 significantly decreased during EMT and positively correlated with the EMT-specific phenotype in cell models. Low ESRP1/RBFOX2 ratio value was associated with a higher risk of metastasis in early breast cancer patients.
High ESRP1 expression may thus stimulate growth of cancer epithelial cells and promote colorectal cancer progression.

In humans, ESRP1 is downregulated in inflamed biopsies from inflammatory bowel disease patients. ESRP1 loss is an adverse prognostic factor in colorectal cancer. Furthermore, generation of ESRP1-dependent GPR137 isoforms is altered in colorectal cancer and expression of a specific GPR137 isoform predicts colorectal cancer patient survival.
Results show that ESRP1 regulates CD44 splice isoform switching and EMT in ovarian cancer cells.
Downregulated ESRP1 by sirna resulted in an isoform switching from CD44v to CD44s, which modulated epithelial-mesenchymal transition.
study defines a Snail-ESRP1 cancer axis that is crucial for human lung carcinogenesis, with implications for new intervention strategies and translational opportunities
Low ESRP1 expression is associated with Invasion and Metastasis of Lung Adenocarcinoma.
effect of ESRP1 and CD44 on human PSC pluripotency is isoform-dependent and that ESRP1-induced CD44 v3 is functionally associated with human PSC pluripotency control
we have demonstrated that ESRP1 overexpression induces G1-phase cell cycle arrest via reducing the stability of the cyclin A2 mRNA.
Splicing factor derived circular RNA circUHRF1 accelerates oral squamous cell carcinoma tumorigenesis via feedback loop.
Proteomics-Based Evidence for a Pro-Oncogenic Role of ESRP1 in Human Colorectal Cancer Cells.
Expression of ESRP1 at human fetomaternal interface and involvement in trophoblast migration and invasion.
Emerging Multi-cancer Regulatory Role of ESRP1: Orchestration of Alternative Splicing to Control EMT.
ISG15 induces ESRP1 to inhibit lung adenocarcinoma progression.
Mining Database for the Clinical Significance and Prognostic Value of ESRP1 in Cutaneous Malignant Melanoma.
APC regulation of ESRP1 and p120-catenin isoforms in colorectal cancer cells.
Epithelial splicing regulatory protein 1 and 2 (ESRP1 and ESRP2) upregulation predicts poor prognosis in prostate cancer.
Prognostic role of TSPAN1, KIAA1324 and ESRP1 in prostate cancer.
ESRP1 regulates alternative splicing of CARM1 to sensitize small cell lung cancer cells to chemotherapy by inhibiting TGF-beta/Smad signaling.
Epithelial Splicing Regulatory Protein 1 Is Overexpressed in Breast Cancer and Predicts Poor Prognosis for Breast Cancer Patients.
ESRP1 as a prognostic factor of non-small-cell lung cancer is related to the EMT transcription factor of Twist.
MiR-337-3p suppresses migration and invasion of breast cancer cells by downregulating ESRP1.
Overexpression of Epithelial Splicing Regulatory Protein 1 in Metastatic Lesions of Serous Ovarian Carcinoma Correlates with Poor Patient Prognosis.
Silencing ESRP1 expression promotes caspase-independent cell death via nuclear translocation of AIF in colon cancer cells.
The Role of ESRP1 in the Regulation of PHGDH in Estrogen Receptor-Positive Breast Cancer.
Matrix stiffness regulates tumor cell intravasation through expression and ESRP1-mediated alternative splicing of MENA.
Splicing factor ESRP1 derived circ_0068162 promotes the progression of oral squamous cell carcinoma via the miR-186/JAG axis.
ESRP1 controls biogenesis and function of a large abundant multiexon circRNA.

name: epithelial splicing regulatory protein 1

reactome.name: Diseases of signal transduction by growth factor receptors and second messengers

summary: ESPR1 is an epithelial cell-type-specific splicing regulator (Warzecha et al., 2009 [PubMed 19285943]).[supplied by OMIM, Aug 2009].
